fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators

Class AtomicEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.SimulationEngine
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.AtomicEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventsExchangingI, ModelDescriptionI, ParentNotificationI, SimulationManagementI, SimulatorI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicRTEngine, HIOA_AtomicEngine

    public class AtomicEngine
extends SimulationEngine
    The class AtomicEngine implements the DEVS simulation protocol to run simulation models that are either atomic or coupled models which submodels all share this atomic engine (i.e., the same simulation algorithm).

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-04-06

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInfluencees(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce, java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> influencees)
      add the given influencees (models that import events exported by this model) to the ones of the given model during in a composition.
      boolean areInfluencedThrough(java.lang.String modelURI, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> modelURIs, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return true if all of the models with the given URIs are influenced by this model through the exported events of the class ce in the current composition; this method should be called after composing the model as it tests for models importing events that are exported by this model modulo a translation.
      void causalEventStep(Time current)
      perform a causal event step i.e., a local update of the state of the model without producing outputs.
      void confluentEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
      process an external input event or an internal event at the given simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the simulated time clock at the time of the call; when more than on event can be executed, only one is chosen and executed.
      void endSimulation(Time endTime)
      terminate the current simulation, doing the necessary catering tasks.
      void externalEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
      process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.
      java.lang.String findProxyAtomicEngineURI(java.lang.String modelURI)
      return the URI of the simulation engine acting as proxy to the given simulation model.
      Value<?> getActualExportedVariableValueReference(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String sourceVariableName, java.lang.Class<?> sourceVariableType)
      search among descendant HIOA of the model with URI modelURI the atomic one that defines the designated variable or its alias and return the reference to the placeholder for its value.
      AbstractAtomicSinkReference getAtomicEngineReference(java.lang.String atomicEngineURI)
      return the reference to the atomic engine as an event exchanging entity.
      java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> getEventAtomicSinks(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the set of atomic event sinks (description of an importing model) for the given event type.
      EventAtomicSource getEventAtomicSource(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the atomic event source (description of an exporting model) for the given exported event type.
      EventsExchangingI getEventExchangingDescendentModel(java.lang.String uri)
      return a direct reference or proxy on the model with URI uri which can receive external events.
      StaticVariableDescriptor[] getExportedVariables()
      return the variables exported by this HIOA.
      SimulationReportI getFinalReport()
      generate and return the final report of the simulation, usually called upon the final state at the end of the simulation.
      StaticVariableDescriptor[] getImportedVariables()
      return the variables imported by this HIOA.
      java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> getInfluencees(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the set of URIs of models that are influenced by this model through the given type of events.
      void hasPerformedExternalEvents(java.lang.String modelURI)
      notify the pa rent model that the child model modelURI has performed its current external events; used when a coupled model has its children models perform the external events sent by other models among its children and need not be called upon its external event step method anymore.
      void hasReceivedExternalEvents(java.lang.String modelURI)
      notify the parent model that the model modelURI has received some external events during the execution of another model internal step and therefore that it will need to perform an external step during the current simulation step.
      void initialiseSimulation(Time simulationStartTime, Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      void internalEventStep()
      process the next internal event by advancing the simulation time to the forecast time of occurrence of this and then do the transition to the next state in the corresponding simulation model.
      boolean isDescendentModel(java.lang.String uri)
      return true if uri is the URI of a descendant model of this coupled model.
      boolean isExportedVariable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<?> type)
      return true if this model exports the designated variable.
      boolean isImportedVariable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<?> type)
      return true if this model imports the designated variable.
      boolean isInfluencedThrough(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String destinationModelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return true if the given model is influenced by this model through the events of the class ce in the current composition; this method should be called after composing the model as it tests for models importing events that are exported by this model modulo a translation.
      boolean isOrdered()
      return true if the model has a precedence relationship with some other models that imposes particular processing, like the production/consumption of variables imposing an order in their initialisation.
      boolean isSimulationInitialised()
      return true if the simulation has been initialised for a run.
      boolean isTIOA()
      return true if the HIOA model is a TIOA i.e., has no exported or imported variables (TIOA imports and exports only events).
      void produceOutput(Time current)
      force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.
      void setImportedVariableValueReference(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String sinkVariableName, java.lang.Class<?> sinkVariableType, Value<?> value)
      search among descendant HIOA of the model with URI modelURI all of the the atomic ones that use the designated variable or its aliases and set in them the reference to the placeholder for its value.
      void setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> simParams)
      set the simulation actual parameters for a simulation run.
      void showCurrentStateContent(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      print the content of the current state, without pre- and post-formatting.
      void storeInput(java.lang.String destinationURI, java.util.ArrayList<EventI> es)
      store external events imported from another simulation model.

      • findProxyAtomicEngineURI

        public java.lang.String findProxyAtomicEngineURI(java.lang.String modelURI)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        return the URI of the simulation engine acting as proxy to the given simulation model.

        As coupled models can be seen as atomic models (by the closure under composition property of DEVS models), models need not have a dedicated simulation engine but rather can share the simulation engine attached to on of their parent coupled model. This method provides a unique mean to get the reference on the simulation engine enacting the given model.

        Contract

         pre     modelURI != null
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        modelURI - URI of the simulation model.
        Returns:
        the URI of the simulation engine acting as proxy to the given simulation model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.findProxyAtomicEngineURI(java.lang.String)

                                 Duration simulationDuration)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.

        Contract

         pre     simulationStartTime != null
 pre     simulationStartTime.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationStartTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 pre     simulationDuration != null
 pre     simulationDuration.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationDuration.greaterThan(Duration.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 pre     isModelSet()
 pre     !isSimulationInitialised()
 post    isSimulationInitialised()

      • internalEventStep

                       throws java.lang.Exception

      • causalEventStep

        public void causalEventStep(Time current)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        perform a causal event step i.e., a local update of the state of the model without producing outputs.

        Causal event steps are used for models with exported variables and they are triggered by internal steps of another model importing these variables. With such a mechanism, algebraic equation models can then be executed only on demand. This is an addition to the standard DEVS simulation protocol.

        Contract

         pre     isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     current != null
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        current - the simulation clock value to which the mode must advance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.causalEventStep(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • produceOutput

        public void produceOutput(Time current)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.

        The implementation follows the principle of the "peer message exchanging implementation" of DEVS i.e., the simulators exchanges directly with each others the exported and imported events without passing through their parent (and ancestors).

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        current - current simulation time at which external events may be output.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:

      • externalEventStep

        public void externalEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.

        The processing first cancel the previously forecast internal event if any and then make the transition to a new model state given the processed external event and then forecast a new internal event.

        Contract

         pre     elapsedTime != null
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time elapsed since the last event executed by this engine.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.externalEventStep(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • setSimulationRunParameters

        public void setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> simParams)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        set the simulation actual parameters for a simulation run.

        As the simulation composed model is accessible only through its root coupled model, this method has to be called through this root. Hence, the parameter values map must contain all of the parameters values and its is propagated to all models in the composed model. Each model should define its own parameters names that are prefixed by the model URI. The map is created to contain values attached to these combined strings (model URI plus parameter name).

        Contract

         pre     simParams != null && simParams.size() > 0
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        simParams - map from parameters names to their values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map)
